history.text: What a great movie that was, Macaulay Culkin had an amazing performance!
I thought it was ok. But lacked in reality a lot

Yeah, it was definitely unrealistic, a young kid isn't going to defend a house against a couple thiefs
.
Not up to the usual John Hughes standards
I suppose a kid could just shoot them though

I would disagree with that though, just because it was unrealistic
 doesn't mean it wasn't a good movie.
As a farce it was good enough
I did laugh some in spots
Definitely. The actor also did a good job making you care. You root so hard for the kid to win.
How about Joe Pesci, I felt sorry for him
Yeah, it wasn't a good look to continually get outsmarted by an 8 year old.
His buddy in crime got it even worse I think
Yup, some of the traps were quite painful!

Clever
 too
The paint can on a rope was good

The foreshadowing when Kevin wished his parents would disappear at the start of the movie
 was a clever plot device.
That was a good set up for the rest of the plot
I always look for the "set up" near the beginning of a film. There usually is one.

And that the power would go out, resetting the alarm clocks so they were in a hurry. Very very unrealistic
 but funny.
Yeah, you need something to get the plot going usually.
For 1990 it was ok
It was also unrealistic that when the family arrived in Paris, they couldn't get a flight back for another two days.
I guess the directors always think the audience is a bit slow witted so they got to "explain: things some.
Flight delays were common then, today too.
Not sure about Paris delays though, that is too popular a destination. Lots of flights from there everyday.
Yeah, it wasn't that the flights were delayed, they were just booked. I figure the airlines would pull some strings in an emergency like that.
I would have thought so too. But then if there was a flight there wount be a movie.
lol

The flight from NY to Paris is still pretty long, the burglars would just have to do everything quicker
 lol.
Ya  a job like that would be done in maybe 15 minutes in real life!
It was a great moment with Marley saves the day by knocking out Harry and Marv with the shovel.
true
It's also nice that Kevin has a new appreciation for his parents when they finally return.
The warm heartfelt ending, classic Hughes.
Yeah, it really wrapped up the movie perfectly!
Too bad they studio messed up with the sequel.
I barely remember the sequels. Do you know if Hughes was behind it?

Home Alone was a great film for its day. Worth another
 watch now and then too.
Not sure if Hughes did the others
Yeah, it's always on tv during Christmas time. It's a great movie to watch with the family and even young kids that weren't even close to being born when the movie came out.
Once Studios own a film they exploit it every way they can for money.
Kids love it cos they get to bash on adults

That's true but sometimes you just want more, more enjoyable movies with similar
 situations.
Happy endings, they stuff we dont get much of anymore
Yeah, it's funny to them that you could stop some criminals with marbles and other wacky things.
I think most movies marketed to kids have happy endings, it's the adult stuff that try to veer away from that.

Hughes was very good at this kind of 
plot
His other films are similar in many ways
Yeah, he was pretty good at developing any plot, he's a great director.
Hughes did not direct, he had Chris Columbus to that
I don't like the responses by the critics. Who would watch that movie and think "sadistic festival of adult-bashing."
oh, my mistake
Hughes wrote it
The harder job, probably
Critics are full of it in my humble opinion
writing isnt a fun job
parts of it are fun though, like the check. lol
Yeah, I used to pay attention to sites like rottentomatoes that showed what critics overwhelmingly think about new releases but the last couple highly rated movies I watched weren't that good.
Definitely and the royalties!
ya
Most evey film with high ratings from a critic was bad in my opinion
I wouldn't say most since even the critics can tell when a movie is entertaining but they fail us with their reviews a lot more than they should.
Very true
DO you think we bashed this up well enough yet?
Definitely, do we just click finish?
Yup
thanks for the convo!
hagd
